description: From French avide, from Latin avidus (“eager, desirous; greedy”), from aveō (“wish, desire, long for, crave”).

adjectives.description: avid (comparative more avid or (less commonly) avider, superlative most avid or (less commonly) avidest)

entries.meaning: enthusiastic; keen; eager; showing great interest in something or desire to do something
examples: an avid fan of 1960s sci-fi movies
